description: The CMake targets file specifies build targets, their configuration, and dependencies used by the project

$schema.description: The schema against which to verify this document

$id.description: A unique identifier for the schema resource

targets.description: The list of build targets defined in the project

^\\w+(/.+)?$.description: The path to the directory where the target is defined. It must be unique and there cannot be more than one target per directory

name.description: A unique name for the target

type.description: The type of binary to generate for this target: static library ('staticLib'), shared library ('sharedLib'), header-only ('interfaceLib'), or executable ('executable')

build.description: Settings used to configure compilation and linking

compileFeatures.description: List of optional CMake compile features required by the target

compileDefinitions.description: List of optional preprocessor definitions applied when compiling this target

compileOptions.description: List of optional compiler options passed to this target

linkOptions.description: List of optional linker options passed to this target

mainFile.description: The main source file (.cpp) that serves as the entry point or primary compilation unit for this target. Must be a path to a file ending with .cpp, .cc, or .cxx

pchFile.description: The header file used as precompiled header (PCH) for this target (optional). Must be a path to a file ending with .h, .hpp, .hxx, .inl or .tpp

headerPolicy.description: Defines the policy applied to the header files

mode.description: Defines whether public headers are split ('split') or merged ('merged') with private headers

includeDir.description: The path to the directory in '/include' from which public headers are collected (only required if mode is 'split')

dependencies.description: The external packages or modules this target depends on

^[^\\s]+$.description: The name of the dependency (called 'PackageName' in CMake)

rulesFile.description: The CMake file that defines how to integrate the dependency into the build system. Must be a path to a file ending with .cmake

minVersion.description: The minimum acceptable version of the dependency

autodownload.description: Whether the dependency can be automatically downloaded if not found locally

optional.description: Indicates whether the dependency is optional (true) or required (false)
